extendedIngredients.name: spinach
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups fresh spinach - rinsed, dried and torn into bite size pieces

title: Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish
summary: Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish might be a good recipe to expand your main course repertoire. This gluten free and primal recipe serves 2 and costs $6.7 per serving. One serving contains 688 calories, 53g of protein, and 51g of fat. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of feta, swordfish steak, garlic, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 85%, which is super. Try Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish, Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish, and Mediterranean Swordfish for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate.                            Cut a slit in steak to create a pocket that is open on one side only. In a cup, mix together 1 tablespoon olive oil and lemon juice; brush over both sides of fish. Set aside.                            In a small skillet, heat 1 teaspoon olive oil and garlic over medium heat. Cook spinach in oil until wilted. Remove from heat, and stuff into pocket. Place feta in pocket over spinach.                            Arrange fish on grill, and cook for 8 minutes. Turn over, and continue cooking until cooked through.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate.
Cut a slit in steak to create a pocket that is open on one side only. In a cup, mix together 1 tablespoon olive oil and lemon juice; brush over both sides of fish. Set aside.
In a small skillet, heat 1 teaspoon olive oil and garlic over medium heat. Cook spinach in oil until wilted.
Remove from heat, and stuff into pocket.
Place feta in pocket over spinach.
Arrange fish on grill, and cook for 8 minutes. Turn over, and continue cooking until cooked through.
